H0.text: Triple bond is the bond in which six electrons are shared between atoms.

H1.text: Ionic bond is the bond type in which six electrons are shared between atoms, after two electrons are shared in a single bond and four electrons are shared in a double bond.

H2.text: Quadruple bond shares six electrons between atoms.

H3.text: Magnetic bond is a bond in which six electrons are shared between atoms, whereas single bonds share two electrons and double bonds share four electrons.

A4.text: A triple bond in chemistry is a chemical bond between two atoms involving six bonding electrons instead of the usual two in a covalent single bond.
